get.description:
This API allows you to retrieve all existing Menu Item Catering Container codes.

OperationId:getCateringContainers

parameters.name: fetchInactive
parameters.description: Determines wether to fetch inactive records or not.

parameters.name: codes
parameters.description: Codes to be searched.

parameters.name: wildCard
parameters.description: Wildcard search on the code.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the code.

200.description: Response object for fetching Catering Code Containers details.

post.description:
Menu Item Catering Containers describe how individual menu item are sold (for example, per piece, per dozen, or each) when they are not included in the price of the menu. The description prints on reports such as the Banquet Event Order (BEO) and Proforma Invoice. This API allows you to create a new Menu Item Catering Container code and description.

OperationId:postCateringContainers

parameters.name: cateringContainers
parameters.description: Request object which holds new Catering Code Containers.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

This API allows you to update an existing Menu Item Catering Container code.

OperationId:putCateringContainers

parameters.name: cateringContainersCode
parameters.description: Unique Catering Container Code

parameters.name: cateringContainers
parameters.description: Request object which holds modified Catering Code Containers.

200.description: Response Body.

delete.description:
This API allows you to delete an existing Menu Item Catering Container code.

OperationId:deleteCateringContainers

parameters.name: cateringContainersCode
parameters.description: Unique Catering Container Code

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

post.description:
You can define Event Forecasts, with or without a market code or a block type, to manage different revenue forecasts for different types of bookings, such as corporate versus social. This API will allow you to create a new Event Forecast.

OperationId:postEventForecasts

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
This API will allow you to update an Event Forecast for a property.

OperationId:putEventForecasts

200.description: Response Body.

delete.description:
This API will allow you to delete an Event Forecast for a property.

OperationId:deleteEventForecasts

parameters.name: eventTypesCode
parameters.description: Unique Event Type Code

parameters.name: forecastsId
parameters.description: Unique Forecast Id

parameters.name: forecastIdExtension
parameters.description: Additional identifying value assigned by the creating system.

parameters.name: forecastIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: forecastIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code to which the Event Forecast belongs to.

parameters.name: revenueTypeCode
parameters.description: Code.

parameters.name: revenueTypeDescription
parameters.description: description.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: A monetary amount.

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: Provides a currency code to reflect the currency in which an amount may be expressed.

parameters.name: amountType
parameters.description: Defines values for Amount Type of an event forecast revenue.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.
